meanings.definition: To pay back (money that is owed)
meanings.sent1: She repaid the borrowed money promptly.
meanings.sent2: He always repaid his debts on time.
meanings.sent3: The kind neighbor repaid the favor by helping with the groceries.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work repaid her with a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent5: The smile on her face repaid his kindness tenfold.

meanings.definition: To make amends for (a wrong or injury)
meanings.sent1: He repaid her for the broken vase by buying a new one.
meanings.sent2: She repaid his forgiveness with sincere apologies.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy repaid the chewed shoe with a wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: His dedication repaid the trust others had lost in him.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset repaid the long wait with breathtaking colors.
